about_the_game:
Trapped deep within a mysterious facility, your connection is limited to that device in your hands. You must use it to interact with your surroundings, operating a computer alongside a strange console that controls the locks in the entire facility. You must help the people trapped inside to escape, but be careful. The locks aren't there just for you.

Your only objective?
Save Everyone.

That doesn't sound so hard, right?

If you're going to succeed, you'll need to pay close attention to what your allies within the facility say. As you are trapped within a single room, they are your only chance at gaining clues in other parts of the facility, clues that will help you to solve the inner workings of the console and help save everyone.

Just this once, everybody lives. But only if you can work together with everyone to solve the puzzles and uncover the secrets of the facility. Fight for everyone's happy ending.

FEATURES

  • Experimental gameplay designed for levered arcade sticks and console controllers, use their unique features to solve kinematic puzzles
  • Communicate with the others trapped inside the facility using the computers chat function
  • Investigate your surroundings to find passwords that will unlock the secrets of the facility
  • A short but story-packed experience intended to be finished in roughly an hour.
  • Featuring an original soundtrack by Razeacc



_____________________________________________________________________

WARNING: Contains themes of Anxiety, Depression, and Suicide

content_descriptors.notes: Deals with themes of self-harm and attempted suicide.

short_description: You Can Save Everyone is a heartfelt horror meta-puzzle game. Trapped deep within a facility with only a console to communicate with the others inside, decipher the proper methods to control the console, and - just maybe - save everyone. But be careful. The locks aren't just there for you.
